chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
a: nat -> R
n: nat

Goal:
(0 < n)%nat -> ex_series a -> Series a = sum_f_R0 a (Init.Nat.pred n) + Series (fun k : nat => a (n + k)%nat)

Premises:
Module Nat := Struct Definition t : Set. Definition zero : nat. Definition one : nat. Definition two : nat. Definition succ : nat -> nat. Definition pred : nat -> nat. Definition add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition double : nat -> nat. Definition mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition sub : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition eqb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition leb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition ltb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition compare : nat -> nat -> comparison. Definition max : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition min : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition even : nat -> bool. Definition odd : nat -> bool. Definition pow : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_addmul : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_mul : nat -> nat -> nat
Notation pred := Init.Nat.pred
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Series = fun a : nat -> R => real (Lim_seq (sum_n a)) : (nat -> R) -> R Argument scope is [function_scope]
ex_series = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) => exists l : V, is_series a l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
Module Init := Struct Definition Unconvertible : forall A : Type, A -> A -> Set. Definition unconvertible : forall (A : Type) (a b : A), Unconvertible A a b -> unit. End 
sum_f_R0 = fix sum_f_R0 (f : nat -> R) (N : nat) {struct N} : R := match N with | 0%nat => f 0%nat | S i => sum_f_R0 f i + f (S i) end : (nat -> R) -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
Series_incr_1 : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> Series a = a 0%nat + Series (fun k : nat => a (S k))
Series_ext : forall a b : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> Series a = Series b
ex_series_Reals_0 : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 a N) l}
ex_series_Reals_1 : forall a : nat -> R, {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 a N) l} -> ex_series a
is_series_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (l : R), is_series a l -> Series a = l
Series_correct : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> is_series a (Series a)
ex_series_dec : forall a : nat -> R, {ex_series a} + {~ ex_series a}
cauchy_finite : forall (An Bn : nat -> R) (N : nat), (0 < N)%nat -> sum_f_R0 An N * sum_f_R0 Bn N = sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun p : nat => An p * Bn (k - p)%nat) k) N + sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun l : nat => An (S (l + k)) * Bn (N - l)%nat) (Init.Nat.pred (N - k))) (Init.Nat.pred N)
sum_n_Reals : forall (a : nat -> R_AbelianGroup) (N : nat), sum_n a N = sum_f_R0 a N
decomp_sum : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), (0 < N)%nat -> sum_f_R0 An N = An 0%nat + sum_f_R0 (fun i : nat => An (S i)) (Init.Nat.pred N)
Cesaro : forall (An Bn : nat -> R) (l : R), Un_cv Bn l -> (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> cv_infty (fun n : nat => sum_f_R0 An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => An k * Bn k) n / sum_f_R0 An n) l
sum_N_predN : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), (0 < N)%nat -> sum_f_R0 An N = sum_f_R0 An (Init.Nat.pred N) + An N
tech2 : forall (An : nat -> R) (m n : nat), (m < n)%nat -> sum_f_R0 An n = sum_f_R0 An m + sum_f_R0 (fun i : nat => An (S m + i)%nat) (n - S m)
derivable_pt_lim_fs : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R) (N : nat), (0 < N)%nat -> derivable_pt_lim (fun y : R => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => An k * y ^ k) N) x (sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => INR (S k) * An (S k) * x ^ k) (Init.Nat.pred N))
Cesaro_1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (l : R), Un_cv An l -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => sum_f_R0 An (Init.Nat.pred n) / INR n) l
Reste_E = fun (x y : R) (N : nat) => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun l : nat => / INR (fact (S (l + k))) * x ^ S (l + k) * (/ INR (fact (N - l)) * y ^ (N - l))) (Init.Nat.pred (N - k))) (Init.Nat.pred N) : R -> R -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope nat_scope]
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : N => match a with | 0%N => 0%nat | N.pos p => Pos.to_nat p end : N -> nat Argument scope is [N_scope]
fct_cte = fun a _ : R => a : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Reste2 = fun (x y : R) (N : nat) => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun l : nat => (-1) ^ S (l + k) / INR (fact (2 * S (l + k) + 1)) * x ^ (2 * S (l + k) + 1) * ((-1) ^ (N - l) / INR (fact (2 * (N - l) + 1))) * y ^ (2 * (N - l) + 1)) (Init.Nat.pred (N - k))) (Init.Nat.pred N) : R -> R -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope nat_scope]
Reste1 = fun (x y : R) (N : nat) => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun l : nat => (-1) ^ S (l + k) / INR (fact (2 * S (l + k))) * x ^ (2 * S (l + k)) * ((-1) ^ (N - l) / INR (fact (2 * (N - l)))) * y ^ (2 * (N - l))) (Init.Nat.pred (N - k))) (Init.Nat.pred N) : R -> R -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope nat_scope]
ex_series_incr_1 : forall a0 : nat -> ?V, ex_series a0 < -> ex_series (fun k : nat => a0 (S k)) where ?K : [a : nat -> R n : nat |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R n : nat |- NormedModule ?K]
lt_pred_n_n : forall n : nat, (0 < n)%nat -> (Init.Nat.pred n < n)%nat
Alembert_C1 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
tech6 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R) (N : nat), 0 <= k -> (forall i : nat, An (S i) < k * An i) -> sum_f_R0 An N <= An 0%nat * sum_f_R0 (fun i : nat => k ^ i) N
sum_n_m = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat) => Iter.iter_nat plus zero a n m : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
sum_n = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n : nat) => sum_n_m a 0 n : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope]
sum_plus : forall (An Bn : nat -> R) (N : nat), sum_f_R0 (fun l : nat => An l + Bn l) N = sum_f_R0 An N + sum_f_R0 Bn N
derivable_pt_lim_finite_sum : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R) (N : nat), derivable_pt_lim (fun y : R => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => An k * y ^ k) N) x match N with | 0%nat => 0 | S _ => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => INR (S k) * An (S k) * x ^ k) (Init.Nat.pred N) end
tech1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, (n <= N)%nat -> 0 < An n) -> 0 < sum_f_R0 An N
S_pred : forall n m : nat, (m < n)%nat -> n = S (Init.Nat.pred n)
